SUMMARY #

U.S. DRUG TESTING SUMMARY Amphetamines Tested for in Standard Drug Tests ? YES Tested for in Extended Drug Tests ? YES Possible to Test for? YES Detection Period in Urine 1-4 days

TEST TYPES #

Urine Testing


                    Context: 
                    This section provides an overview of amphetamine drug testing, describing its inclusion in standard U.S. drug tests, methods of detection (urine, hair, saliva), detection windows, and factors affecting results, as part of Erowid’s comprehensive Chemicals Vault on substances, drug testing, health, and legal information.

Erowid name: amphetamines
Category: CHEMICALS
Field: Testing

                    Text: 
                    TEST TYPES #

Urine Testing

Amphetamine (amphetamine and methamphetamine) is one of the "SAMHSA-5", the five drugs tested for in U.S. government-approved basic drug tests. Amphetamines are standardly detectable in urine for 1-3 days after use. Methamphetamines stay in the system slightly longer, 3-5 days. The Amphetamine test is a one step competitive immunoassay that is used to screen for the presence of amphetamine in urine. It is a chromatographic absorbent device in which drug or drug metabolites in a sample compete with drug conjugate immobilized on a porous membrane for a limited number of binding sites. This test is a rapid, qualitative immunoassay for the detection of amphetamine in urine. The cutoff concentration for this test is 1000 ng/ml, as recommended by the Substance Abuse and Mental Health Services Administration. The cutoff for GC-MS, which detects d-amphetamine and methamphetamine, is 500 ng/ml.

Hair Testing


                    Context: 
                    This section details the types of drug tests used to detect amphetamines, specifically outlining how urine and hair samples are analyzed, detection timeframes, testing methods, and threshold concentrations, as part of Erowid's comprehensive overview of amphetamine drug testing procedures and detection windows.

                    Text: 
                    Hair Testing

Amphetamine is detectable with hair tests and is included in the standard set of substances tested for with these tests. Hair tests generally take the most recent 1.5 inches of growth and use those for testing. That provides a detection period of approximately 90 days. If an individual's hair is shorter than 1.5 inches, this detection period will be shorter.

Saliva Testing

In the past few years, new technologies have been developed which allow for saliva testing for the presence of Methamphetamine and its derivatives. We do not currently have information about what the detection period is for these tests.

FALSE POSITIVES #

Substances or Conditions which can cause false positives


                    Context: 
                    This section provides details on the detection of amphetamines through alternative drug testing methods—specifically hair and saliva tests—summarizing detection windows, inclusion in standard screening panels, and noting a lack of definitive information for saliva test windows. It immediately precedes the document’s discussion on substances and conditions known to cause false positives for amphetamines, and follows a broader overview of urine testing protocols and detection periods for amphetamines in common drug screenings.

                    Text: 
                    CAUTION & DISCLAIMER #

Erowid's drug testing information is a summary of data gathered from site visitors, journal articles, websites, and other resources. Detection periods depend on amount and frequency of use, metabolic rate, body mass, age, overall health, drug tolerance, and urine pH of each individual. Many substances that are not tested for in basic or extended urinalysis tests CAN be tested for by a laboratory willing to go to the trouble, although that is uncommon.
